text:
I cannot believe this restaurant actually has good reviews, so perhaps I was incredible unlucky and everything went wrong in the kitchen. Anyway, here is my lousy experience: 
We were staying at the Stratosphere and where too lazy to go out to eat at some other location. So we agreed to check out the Italian restaurant inside the hotel. The place was cute, lots of people in there so we figured that it had to be good. The service was good and I water was really nice. I asked him what he recommended and he suggested the Mediterranean Linguine and since I love seafood I went with it. We were a party of four so we also ordered an appetizer of stuffed mushroom and garlic cheese bread. The appetizer came and the mushroom was alright. Nothing out of this world, it was all covered in a tick layer of cheese, so of course it was going to taste good. That was about the only thing that tasted good in our entire meal. The garlic bread was terrible. It was literally old bread with melted cheese and no garlic flavor. My pasta was discusting! All the seafood was chewy and over cooked. So I tried to eat just the pasta alone and it tasted horrible too! Everyone in my party ordered something different and no one finished their meals. The two gusys ordered steak and I guess it was ok (they both said that the one at the buffet was better) but their sides of potatoes and pasta tasted horrible. The other girl that was with us ordered veal parmesane and she barely touched it.
Then we got the $120 dollar tab , with gratuity included I have to add. And it was painfly to pay. EVERYTHING TASTED TERRIBLE! First time this happens to me anythwhere. Anyway, never EVER coming back

Stayed at Stratosphere for the weekend and ended up eating here twice. The food is delicious. The prices are great for the pasta dishes and reasonable for the meat dishes, and wine by the glass prices are excellent, too.

We received excellent, friendly service both nights. I also appreciated that there are many healthier options on the menu, which is a pleasant change from the usual Las Vegas buffet. I LOVED the pasta primavera and highly recommend it if you are a vegetarian or just looking for a fresh and light-tasting meal.

So my boyfriend and I went here for valentine's day dinner and him being a former waiter he is always the biggest critic throughout the entire meal. Well there were good things and bad things as there are in all new restaurant experiences but I have to say there was more good than bad.
Loved:
Ambaince
Lighting
Music
Mozzarella fritte 
Rib eye 
Ravioli
Chicken marsala

No love:
Waiters didn't really pay attention to us, I believe he thought we weren't going to tip properly but being partnered with a former Waiter we always tip 18-20%. He didnt bring us any bread and everytime we tried to ask about it because we saw it at other tables he simply ignored us. We actually got brought back the same shrimp that we sent back. Which takes me to the other thing I didn't love, the shrimp was overcooked and hard, so much so, I had to send it back for a redo.

Although there was good and bad, we really liked it here and will definitely return. Hopefully the Waiter will have more respect for us next time because regardless of the fact that I didn't like the service, we still tipped appropriately.

Wow!
Saw this place yesterday, but already had dinner plans. I saw they had Eggplant Parmesan on the menu, so I made plans for dinner the following night.
Service is fantastic. One seats you, another brings water, another brings bread. Let's start with the bread - your normal sourdough loaf BUT THE BUTTER - 2 little scoops sitting in olive oil and Italian spices. Dang that's good! I usually don't eat the bread ("why risk the carbs?" - Get Smart) but I ate ALL THE BREAD.
Now onto the Shrimp Scampi Venezia. So good. I ordered more bread to soak up the garlic white wine sauce.
Eggplant Parmesan. I started with the sauce - always start with just the sauce. More on the salty side rather than the sweet side. Not overly salty, just pointing out the difference. Personally, I prefer Prego brand over Ragu brand (sweet vs salty). The eggplant is thiiiick - the way it should be. I want to know I'm eating a vegetable, not a deep fried vegetable skin. This is spot on. Comes with side of pasta or potato.
I will be back. Very enjoyable experience.
Absolutely amazing food and service. The stuffed shrimp is fantastic and the chocolate mousse is to die for. We went back over and over again!

Fellini's is a great little restaurant in the Stratosphere. Granted, the Stratosphere is not the Four Season's but, Fellini's is definitely worth a visit. I did not expect much when a friend an I sat down for dinner here but, I was pleasantly surprised. 

The cheese ravioli was absolutely delicious. Even the bread with olive oil and butter spread was amazing. The pizza, chicken Alfredo, and Caesar salad are also yummy dishes. The portions are large and the prices are fair. 

The atmosphere is dark and very intimate. The staff was very friendly and very attentive.

During my recent vacation, I returned to my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas -- Fellini's. The food was amazing as always. And everyone was so nice -- the host, the server, and the boys that refilled drinks and brought out food. Everyone took such good care of us. No one disappointed us. This was by far the best dining experience we had while in Las Vegas. Â I can't wait to go back.

SUCH A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. On Valentine's night (last night) me and my boyfriend were calling Italian restaurants for a last minute reservation. We came up on fellinis and called and said they could take us in right away ( all the other restaurants were booked). we were seated quickly, the restaurant is quiet and small and very elegant looking yet simple. We got our food very quickly and everything was good until it came time to pay. When the bill was brought to us my boyfriend took out his bank card and the waiter took it and came back & said it didn't go through. My boyfriend told him to swipe it again because he was sure there was money on it, the waiter came back & once again said there wasn't. My bf left me at the table while he went to an atm & later found out he had already been charged!!! All that embarrassment for nothing?! He told the waiter and the waiter said "sorry about that here's your receipt"  & they still had the audacity to take out money for their tip from his card!!!!it was a shitty sorry he didn't formally apologize or offer us a free desert or anything for the humiliation he made us go through!!! Never will we ever go there again!!!

Went here while on a vacation in an attempt to try a mid-range Strip restaurant. Being located actually in the Stratosphere Casino, we figured it would be a tourist trap place, on par with casual places you would find at Macaroni Grill or Carrabba's, and we were right 
Admittedly, the service was great. I rate service, and my tip percentage, based on how well the waiter can keep my water glass full (I down glasses like I just spent 2 months in the desert), and I never once found mine empty. Unfortunately, this is where the greatness ended. The food was moderately priced (on par or only slightly more than you would find in an average sit-down place), but was only moderately flavored. Besides the side Caesar salad I had, everything we ordered was bland and deemed unfinishable about halfway through. Any sense of atmosphere or intimacy was ruined by the somewhat tacky paintings/furnishings and loud, stereotypical Las Vegas strip patrons.
Overall, not the worst place to find an alternative to Olive Garden if you are staying on the Strip. But if you are wanting to taste some authentic Italian fare, you are better off doing as the locals and finding something far away from the Strip.

Food is delicious, everything made fresh to order!!  Joe and his staff never disappoint.  Nice ambiance.  We have been coming here for 10 years and Fellini's is always out first stop.  Not only is the food fabulous but Joe makes you feel like family!!  Tortellini Abbruzzese is my favorite.  Hubby has had fabulous steaks there, bracciole with fettucini in a red sauce.  Brick oven pizza and a salad.  Everything is great!

Had our Wedding dinner on 11-11-16 at Fellini's with about 60 guests. We made our reservations over the phone with Joe. He was really good at responding to our phone calls & emails. 

They put us in our own private room. Their service was excellent from beginning to end! 
The food was delicious! We also ordered the cake through them and it was one of the best cakes we've ever had!

We're so happy we decided to have our reception at Fellini's! Our guests are still talking about how good the food was!
Outstanding service with good food. A bit pricey but very generous entree portions that are perfectly cooked and well-presented. You will be nicely taken care of in an inviting setting.

This is a must visit every time I hit Vegas for a Conference. Took a coworker  there last Wednesday  for his first experience and now he is a convert. Thanks to Chef Joe, Rusty and all the crew. See you next month.
This may be one of the best kept secrets in Vegas.  They are not owned by the casino so they are not restricted on their budget for quality.   Awesome staff and even better food!!

This is not an authentic Italian restaurant, as they serve fried ravioli, among fried everything else.  I chose to get the waygu steak, which was not very tender.  The only thing that got this restaurant 2 stars was the really nice paintings on the walls.

Best italian food ive had. I would definetly come back. Came here for my girlfriend and I 3 year anniversary.  And we both loved it. Staff is good. Food came out perfect. Very good pricing for place like this. Cant wait to go back

Fellini's seems to specialize in serving over-sized portions of mediocre pasta swimming in grease. As if this weren't enough, the also charge a price per meal as if this were some sort of amazing authentic cuisine, rather than box pasta in a small lake of butter. The deserts were passable, but nothing to write home about.

As for the service, my partner and I were relatively impressed until we got our bill. When ordering our pasta, the waiter asked if we would like soup or salad. I responded, "Oh, I didn't realize that was included. What are the salad options." The waiter responded Caesar or garden greens and we went from there. The bill arrives after desert and it turns out we have been charged $17.00 for two salads. When I spoke to the waiter about this he told me that all of the menu items are a la carte. When I responded that he had failed to mention this when I had indicated it was my understanding the salads were included as a side with the pasta, he insisted this was my error and did nothing to rectify the situation. 

Overall we had a mediocre dining experience coupled with absolutely unforgivable customer service. We will never be eating at Fellini's again, and recommending that our friends and family avoid this place when visiting Las Vegas.
Everything is good. The steak is especially delicious~ just like those cooked in Turscany. Nice.

On March 8,2014 we had the wedding of our dreams and everything went perfect!  We had reservations at Fellini's for dinner for our special day! From the moment we entered Felinni's it felt warm and welcoming! When we got to our table our cake was in the center of the table. When I ordered the cake (Chocolate Bavarian Creme cake) I thought it was a regular cake but it was a perfect wedding cake decorated with white frosting and pink roses.  

If you visit Fellini's ask for Steve! He made our Wedding dinner unforgettable and remembered everyone's name in our group.  The food is perfecto and you will leave wanting more! My husband had rib eye steak with their house sauce that melted in your mouth!!!! I had tortellini that was delicious!!! The steak was so good we had to go back again a few days later!!!  

If you are in Vegas this is the place to get awesome food and an experience you will never forget!

I have been here a few times and the food has always been excellent. I have had the Fettuccine Capriciana which is the best dish I have had thus far: fettuccine with mushrooms and shrimp sautÃ©ed in olive oil. The small shrimp tend to look to be undercooked but still delish. The shrimp fra diavolo, linguini with baby clams served in a rich broth of garlic, fresh herbs and of course olive oil. We chose the red sauce and it made a great left over dish as well. My other friend had the shrimp Alfredo and it was also amazing. The busser was really helpful but the waiter although very nice really takes him time on things. I would come back here again most def.

I incorrectly thought the restaurant was in the tower, wishful thinking.  Food was adequate, not great.  Parking garage was messy and gross.  Casino was not nice to walk through either.  The main reason we chose the restaurant was it was open until midnight.  The service was good, very nice people waited on us.

My boyfriend and I were looking to go to a nice restaurant, we were staying at the stratosphere and wanted to stay semi-local. We looked into The Top of the World Restaurant and we weren't impressed with the reviews saying the food was just okay, especially for the price. We ended up getting the Stuffed Mushroom, a bottle of Champagne, two Entrees, and a dessert for $115. All the food was phenomenal, I wish I could have eaten all of it. I could talk for days about the customer service. This was really the part that blew me away. The waiter refilled our champagne glasses multiple times and was there to ask us how the food was frequently. He was incredible. When I come out to Vegas I will definitely be returning. I still can't get over what a great experience it was, it really doesn't get any better than this. If you're debating where to go, look no further. Go here or you'll be missing out on one of the best dining experiences of your life.

Ok so to start I didn't expect much it's a resturant in the hotel. I figured it would be ok. But no the food wad amazing. Our waiter was ok. But Louis the bust boy was working his a** off I have never seen someone work so hard before at a ristorante. We complement mangement and I hope they took us serious, the food was geat but louis really impressed us. I hope to come back soon. -goose
Was excited to eat @ Fellini's. Was highly recommended. Service was spot on, friendly.  My braciole meal was ok, a bit too salty for my taste. I still recommend.

This place is amazing! We were staying on site and were looking for dinner for our anniversary. My husband is Italian so I rarely suggest Italian restaurants but after reading reviews I took a chance. So glad I did!

The service was amazing. Fastest service ever. Literally minutes for our main dishes to be served. 

We had the bruschetta for an appetizer and right away knew we had made a good choice. The bread was perfect and the tomatoes were delicious. My husband special ordered a penne all'arrabbiata that was not on the menu. They hit the nail on the head. A little spicier than normal but delicious. Perfect pink sauce. I ordered the Tortellini Abbruzzese. Holy cow! It was amazing. Just so so good. The peas with the sausage were a delicious combination. The tortellini was cooked to perfection. 

Will definitely come back and ready told my friends about it! Nice work Fellini's.

Well we were a little disappointed Monday night. We have been waiting six months to visit our favorite place in the Stratosphere and what a let down. Our favorite dish is the Linguine Mediterranean. We've had it two times in the past and it we totally think it's excellent. This time however we were let down big time. The pasta was overcooked, shrimp overcooked, all of it bad. We had about 13 of the clams and two of the mussells not opened. I never would have served my customers unopened shells. Anyway, i posted pictures of the dish online (we ordered two and this is a combination of the two dinners) so you can see. We want to give Fellini's a chance to impress us again so we will go one more time. Although, it's too soon now for the wife. I'll post again after we eat there next time. The two stars is because of what we were served. If this was just a fluke, I'll raise it back.

Fellini's Restorante had the best food and outstanding wedding cake I've ever tasted. Mimi took really good care of us and explained to us what we were getting. I booked this place for our wedding and they beyond met my expectations... thank you to the chef and we highly recommend this fantastic restaurant to anyone who is looking for great authentic Italian food. Thank you for making my wedding a memorable one.

We gave five stars because Fellini's offers consistently scrumptious and authentic Italian food with a wait staff that is courteous, and sophisticated.  
This was our second trip to Fellini's in the last two months.  Our first experience was excellent.  From the food, to the manager, to the wait staff, we had zero complaints.
Well, we were anxious to give it a second go, and were definitely not disappointed.  Although we did miss chatting with Joe and Mark about great Brassy R&B groups, our waiter Velon was classy and professional, and once again, our food was traditional Mediterranean flare, prepared with a true homemade feel. 
Our meal started with freshly baked bread and butter which is smothered in seasoned dipping oil and vinegar.  These dipping oils are wickedly addicting, and if you are not careful, you can easily not leave room for your entree.
We enjoyed the Mozzarella Caprese salad which was a generous portion of fresh mozzarella, and tomatoes,slices garnished with basil, onions, olives and oil & vinegar.  Our next course was an exquisite shrimp Cesar Salad.  Again a generous portion of salad garnished with several grilled shrimp (not just two, but maybe six), and a delicious, fresh dressing.  One of the better Cesar dressings we've enjoyed (my wife is Italian so we have had our share of Cesar Dressings).
Our entree was the most originally prepared Filet Mignon marinated in Cabernet 
Sauvignon and topped with a Portobello and Roasted Red Peppers.   This is possibly the best piece of Red Meat I have ever had!  I also have to confess I ordered this last time I was here, and it was every bit as delicious and decadent this time as last!  I'm not sure how they do it, but the Streak is so well seasoned and infused with the Cabernet, as well as being so tender it literally melts in your mouth.  Once again, I must say that the portioned are very good size, and you definitely do not go away hungry.  The entree's also come with the pasta of the day, which is also quite yummy.  Their chef is a true pro with a great red sauce.
We finished the evening off with a light but luscious lemon cake drizzled with powdered sugar and chocolate.   
In summary: superb Italian cuisine, excellent wait staff, well worth every cent- we will definitely be regulars when in Vegas.

After a long day of running around Vegas I was happy to rest my weary legs at the bar and settle in for some comfort food.  I got a caesar salad - spot on, the vongele linguini - white not red sauce, also spot on - and a couple glasses of super tuscan wine.  yes, i had Red wine with my White sauce, and i liked it.  The server at the bar was amazing, friendly old school vegas.  The owner Joe even popped by, amazing guy.  This is fine restaurant, well worth your time and dollar.  Got cannolis too, one of my favorite things, and that may have been a bit much for one person but not their fault.  Excellent, and i'm picky about my cannolis.  Try the nucella - it's a black walnut liqueur - as an appertif.  Fa bene!  Fellini's is STRONG.

I really enjoy having dinner here. All their dishes have been superb. You really can't go wrong with any of their entrees here. The service is also excellent. I had to knock off a star though for not having fresh Parmesan isn't that a necessity for an Italian restaurant? I haven't had a bad dish yet and recommend them all depending on what you're craving that day.

My mom and I came here after finding this place on Yelp. I think it was way better than the rating it had. 

We were seated as soon as we arrived. We came on a Tuesday night so I'm sure that's why they weren't that busy. We were taken to a cute room with a mural on the wall so it looked as if we were sitting in a courtyard looking out onto canal. The lights were very dim but every table had a candle so it was good enough to where I could read the menu without any issues. 

We started off with garlic cheese bread which was DELICIOUS. They gave us 8 slices which was more than enough. The bread was very soft and the flavor was just great especially to dip in the sauce of our entrees. 

I ordered the chicken Alfredo which is what I always get at Italian restaurants. It was supposed to come with bow tie pasta but I asked for fettuccine instead and they gladly accommodated me. In my opinion , this is the best chicken Alfredo I've had up to date. My mom ordered the spaghetti carbonara and I had to taste a little because it looked so good & it was also delicious! I haven't tried to many carbonaras but this was the best I've had. 

The waiter checked back frequently and was very nice & the prices of our entrees were the same as if we went to Olive Garden but they tasted a million times better. 

I definitely recommend this restaurant & I intend to come back each time I visit Vegas.
Friendly service, big portions, nice murals...Following a nice dinner with new friends, 3 out of the 4 of won cash on the slots!

I have stayed at the Stratosphere  for over 12 years. Fellini's is a major reason I stay there. Being from New Orleans I will always go to a place that treats me right, has very good food, gives you enough for the money, and are friendly. With that said, i was reading what everybody else said about this place. When somebody says the chocolate dessert was too sweet, I've seen enough of that comment. Believe me you will not be disappointed at this place. I'm check in in about 2 weeks.....Been looking at the menu on line........Always want my favorites but want to to try new. Yea 12 years and and haven't done the whole menu......I know 5 star & I know 4 Star .....You WILL like it.

Being from out of state, I spent weeks of research trying to find a highly rated restaurant that not only had great food but was affordable, I finally found it at Fellini's. We had a welcome/rehearsal dinner here for my son's wedding with 54 people and it couldn't have turned out any better. Chef Joe was so professional and easy to work with. He was willing to change up the group menu a bit to accommodate us. The food was absolutely delicious and there was so much of it. The restaurant is a quaint little place tucked away on the ground floor of the Stratosphere. Our private room that holds up to 60 people had beautiful murals painted on every wall making the space feel warm and cozy. Not only was food excellent, the wait staff didn't miss a thing, they truly were incredible. Our son and his wife and many of our guests just raved about the food and service. We also ordered a 3 tiered wedding cake that was to feed 50 guests. It was beautifully decorated, super delicious and was large enough to feed at least 70 people. If you're looking for great food and excellent service, this is the place for you. If you can't tell already, I highly recommend this place.

The food , service and atmosphere were amazing .We went for steak dinner at an Italian restaurant and were glad we did ,steaks were cooked just right potatoes were full of flavor and the salads were fresh ,we will return here again to try out their Italian dishes next time were in Vegas. Cant forget desert we had the mini canoli's delicious !

This place is conveniently located in the Stratosphere, but the food is NOWHERE near the quality of the price. I could have been unlucky or just picked the wrong dishes, but I felt a little robbed. 

The service was great - attentive, professional, and just charming. My water was never half full, and the complimentary bread was awesome. 

I ordered the eggplant parmesan, and my boyfriend got the Mediterranean seafood linguine. 

The portions are really huge, which some people like, but I'd choose quality over quantity any day. His dish was full of seafood and linguine, but the seafood was not well-cooked (some was good but other pieces were rubbery) and the flavor of the sauce was really bland. 

My eggplant parmesan had a good flavor, but it was a tad oily and the side really wasn't well-planned. Every entree includes a side of either pasta or potatoes. Potatoes as a side didn't fit the eggplant parmesan, so I chose the pasta. I assumed, since Fellini's is an Italian restaurant, that the pasta would be good, but I swear the pasta I make at home is better. They served the spiral pasta with the most bland marinara sauce, no cheese or anything. It was something out of a cafeteria. The eggplant tasted really great; it was breaded and cooked well, so it melted in my mouth, but the sauce was the same average marinara sauce. Of course, like most chain Italian places, they put an overwhelming amount of cheese over everything. 

Overall, I would not go back.

My family is currently staying at the stratosphere so we decided to check this place out because it was located in the hotel. The only reason this place got 3 stars from me is because my family like their dishes which lead me to believe i must have chosen the wrong dish. I had chicken Alfredo which is a very safe dish and alot of places make very good alfredo...boy was i wrong. The blacken chicken just tasted like charcol and the Parmesan sauce tasted like creamy nothing. I had to pile on a mountain of Parmesan cheese on top to get a small amount of flavor. Especially for the price I was not please. 

I might and that a very weak might return to this restaurant if i can find a more flavorful dish.

We went here based off yelp reviews, and they do not lie! The food was amazing, home made authentic Italian food. I had the penne crab asparagus pasta and my boyfriend had a chicken Alfredo. The portions were pretty big! We had two Caesar salads for an appetizer and the croutons were homemade as well. Our server and his assistant were amazing, our waters were constantly filled and the complimentary bread and dipping sauce were constantly full. They passed around a dessert cart, and the creme brÃ»lÃ©e was to die for. The entire staff was so friendly, we were told to have a great night by every one of them as we were walking out! They aren't pricey, we spent less than $$$. The best restaurant in the Stratosphere hands down!

ONLY SUGGESTION: they do not have a cocktail list, but a full bar so if your not a huge drinker pick out a cocktail before hand. The classic margarita was great.

Me and two friends went there last night. One of my friends had been there before. I went with his suggestion and got the Fettucine Capriciana. It was a fettucini with a lot of small shrimp (the tail shells already off), mushrooms, vodka, a creamy tomato sauce. Sooooooo good! It was $17.95.
My friend that had been there before also recommended the Chicken Alfredo. So my other buddy got that. It was a very good alfredo sauce (yes, I tried it!) and the best part was that unlike most alfredo sauces, it didn't get thick and clumpy as it cooled. It stayed very well. It was not priced bad at $16.95.
Now the not so good - My friend that had been there several times and loves the food.... He wanted to try something new. He got the Cappalini with shrimp and rapini (broccoli rab). Don't get this. He said it was bland, and had no extra sauce. Granted the menu says that it is made with olive oil. But it was not juicy. Had a very dry look. I tried it and I could not taste the garlic even. If that was first time for all three of us and we all had that, we would never come back. That must be their one bad meal. Just say no to it! Oh! and it is $19.95! So the cheaper the better at this place.

A couple quick tips:
Oh and get the cheesy bread! it is about $6.95 but VERY worth it!
Don't get a soup or salad to start your meal. It costs extra and it is not necessary. I'm 6'1 220 and I was full after eating some of the cheesy bread and the meal. 
I saw a guy get a pizza. It looked delicious! I didn't go over and try it, but it looked great.

There are no windows in the place, it is in the corner behind the poker room but nicely decorated. The male server was nothing special. Not bad, not good. The Spaghetti Bolognese is priced only at I think $16. Spaghetti and meatballs I think $14. Lasagna sounds good there and it was in the mid teens I believe.
I will definitely be back. Most likely getting the same Fettucine Capriciana again. It is great!

Fellini's is located in the Stratosphere Hotel on the main strip of Las Vegas. We decided to have dinner there as it was open late and had pretty good reviews. Needless to say it was a worthwhile experience dining here. The food was delicious to say the least. And the service and ambiance was excellent. We had the calamari and bruschetta for appetizers and I had steak and fettuccini alfredo for my main course. 5 stars all around for this establishment. If you're looking for some good old fashioned and delicious Italian food look no further I guarantee Fellini's will be more than satisfying. Bravo!

Pretty good food. The pricing isn't too bad and the food is pretty good. I got the ravioli. The sauce was incredible. They have an okay wine selection. I'd expect more from an Italian place. The potatoes that came with my husbands food were bland. I ordered a side of meatballs and they were ok. Nothing special.  I would give it another try

We had our wedding on June 29th and the service was great once again. The dinner for 13 with drinks and dinner along with desert was under 700. That included the tip and all costs. Would recommend to anyone looking for a beautiful setting for a Romantic dinner. Very happy once again..
This restaurant is inside the Stratosphere Hotel and Casino. Food and service was excellent and it is reasonably priced. Great desert menu !

This place was a very last minute find, because we were STARVING, but it was so nice inside! We were looking for somewhere somewhat sophisticated, and this was just perfect. The walls are painted as if you are walking the streets of Italy, with flowers in the windows and cobblestone roads. Our server was a little interesting..but entertaining. He pulled out his chair and sat down at our table to take our orders...HA! But he definitely knew his stuff.. he didn't write anything down and all of it was correct to the T. 

The food was alright, nothing too fancy. I had veal marsala and it could have had a little more shabang to it... But still a good meal. The carbonara was amazing though (once again...sharing plates...)!! Although that dish is usually always a winner... 

This place would be great for a hot date, intimate family meal (not great for little kids though), or just good friends. And prices are pretty reasonable for the fairly elegant setting.

This place is the bomb!!! I had the Chicken Paisano and it was beyond delicious. The interior of the restaurant is beautiful. You would not know it standing from the outside. As soon as you head into the main dinner area, the decor is designed to make you feel as though you were dining in Italy. It was really pretty. 

The waiters were very attentive. They were dressed well and were professional. 

I will definitely come back here.

Went on a great date with my other half and we both enjoyed our meals. I ordered the Filet Mignon and my other half ordered the Beef Braciole. Both meals were amazing, the staff was very friendly and made sure we were having a great time. I definitely recommend this place.

My husband and I ordered eggplant parmigiana and cheese ravioli. Both were so yummy. Service was very good and our food came quickly after we ordered. Also, the ambience was very pretty. If you ever stay in Las Vegas, do check out this restaurant!

Fellini's is definitely "Old Vegas" Italian restaurant. Old-fashioned murals on the walls, fake balconies with fake Ivy hanging down from them. You get the picture. The waiters are all with white shirts and black vests. I have to admit, even though it is very touristy, I like it.
The service was excellent. I wore glasses never got lower than halfway emptied.
The wife and I decided to share the grilled shrimp Caesar salad and a Fellini Pizza. We loved the Caesar salad. The grilled shrimp on top was a very nice touch. Just the right amount of dressing and parmesan cheese. The pizza was good, though not great. Tons of sausage, salami, olives, peppers. A fairly good crossed also. And the price, $15 for the pizza, was fair.

I brought a large group here and when I say large, I mean about 60 people with half those being military veterans.  I was running an event to take them out to dinner and then to see the MJ Live performance afterwards (date night for our service members).

I should have let them know that we had a show to catch at 7pm and it was crucial that we have enough time for food, which is my fault for not saying anything - HOWEVER, when I finally did ask about the food and let them know the time situation at 6:30 they were extremely quick to accommodate and they did it with a smile!  The servers were quick, polite, and helpful.

Because I rushed my group, it was like having chow and they didn't have time for dessert.  Joe (nicest guy) was kind enough to have all the desserts boxed up, allowed me to leave them at the restaurant, and took my bag that had materials in it for our veterans and stored it in the wine area.  The staff really went above and beyond!

I come to Vegas once  month to do events for our veterans and I have worked with a lot of venues in this area.  The service is all over the place and on a wide range from "I'll do the bare minimum so don't ask for much to impressive" and I have to say this particular venue was the latter.  

I didn't have dinner until much, much later because I was tending to my group most of the time, but it was boxed up for me and I'll say the chicken marsala was good!  If you have a large group and you are doing a show or anything in the Stratosphere, I highly recommend this.  Thank you to the staff and Joe once more - Joe is also very comical when you seem a little stressed which was nice to have.
The restaurant was a surprise. The food was really good and the place was fine. The Veal Piccata was excellent but the portion was small. Maybe because it was so rich. Highly recommended.

Came here around 5:30p on a holiday and this large restaurant was pretty deserted.  Got served right away.  Service was fine.  Waiter took our order and asked if we wanted garlic bread.  I said OK.  Didn't realize it was not a freebie.  Would have ordered another appetizer had I known that.  

No windows here, so there are wall-sized murals of scenes from Italy giving you the feeling that you're sitting al fresco in a restaurant in Italy.  I've seen this in other Italian restaurants both here and in Italy.  Works here because what casino restaurant in Vegas has windows?

My clams with linguini was excellent.  Really enjoyed the mixed greens with a super raspberry vinegarette dressing.  Also enjoyed the Snickers cake as well.  

It's a nice place, but you can come casually dressed if you want.

Christmas Eve having soup, salad and a nice bottle of wine.  Top it off with two fabulous desserts and our server Greg was amazing. Let's not forget the espresso which is such a European  tradition and I will definitely be back!

Restaurant accommodated two separate reservations of 14 because we did not want to be restricted to a group menu.  The restaurant worked with getting everyone in both reservations seated together and in the same room. We selected this restaurant for our reception dinner.  Food was great, atmosphere was nice and staff was friendly. They changed the music in our area to meet our needs without having to ask and they also assisted with cutting and serving wedding cake to everyone.  Great for large groups.

I was absolutely pleased and satisfied with the quality of both the service and the food at Fellini's! My boyfriend and I made reservations for 6:30pm and were immediately seated in a beautiful room with a high painted ceiling of clouds and a wall that had a beautiful painting of something straight out of Venice! This place had a romantic vibe with dim lighting and plenty of tables for groups of two and more. After being seated, the water guy immediately filled our cups. After deciding on our orders we were given a basket of bread with a delicious butter and seasoned olive oil spread. Our first basket of bread tasted stale but the next basket was SO warm, fluffy, and tasty. 
Check groupon for deals! We had a groupon for two entrees and two soups or salads. They want you to reserve a table ahead of time, which you can do online or via phone. When you do, make sure to say that you have a groupon with the reservation.
Entrees came with either house potatoes or pasta of the day.
I had the Garden Salad with honey mustard dressing and the North Atlantic Salmon seasoned with a blend of spices, grilled then topped with a lemon caper cream sauce. I had their house potatoes with my order.
My boyfriend had the shrimp caesar salad with caesar dressing and the Osso Buco Milanese, a veal shank braised in a sauce of vegetables and tomatoes, served with risotto Milanese.
Ohmygoodness the food was SO good, I can't even begin to describe it. I don't know what they put in that honey mustard dressing, but it's the best I've had so far! I never had lemon caper cream sauce before and I found it absolutely delicious paired with my salmon. I am a big salmon lover, but 3/4 of the way through I got kinda sick of it....or maybe I was already halfway full from the bread and salad loll. The potatoes were super tasty as well! I think the waiter said it was cooked with wine! Even though I felt so stuffed and bloated, I couldn't help but steal some of my boyfriend's veal, which was the BOMB. At his first bite, he closed his eyes and made noises that showed just how good it was! The meat was so tender and just fell off the bone. They gave him a cutest little fork to eat out of the bone marrow.The taste and texture of the meat was reminded me of Chinese braised beef!  The risotto was kinda weird for me because it looked like really dry mac n' cheese but tasted okay. His dish was HUGE. He was only able to finish a little more than half of the plate. We ended up packing up our food and giving it to a homeless lady since we couldn't keep it in the hotel. 

This place is quite expensive but very worth every dollar; and our groupon definitely helped. I would recommend this place if anyone is in the area! Only negative thing I can say is that it's unfortunate the Stratosphere is all of the way at the other end of the main festivities of the strip so it took us an hour to walk from Caesar's Palace to here. And come earlier because around 7pm the place began filling up fast. There was barely anyone here when we came at 6:30.

Delicious.  Absolutely delicious.  Good service, at the pace the entire rest of the world enjoys.  You aren't rushed from course to course.  Only Americans like to have plate after plate slammed down in front of them with no time to talk or digest in between.  Our 3 course dinner took us about an hour to enjoy. Servers were attentive but not clingy.  I had the Caprese Salad and Osso Bucco.  My sister had the Caesar salad and Lamb Chops.  It was the most delicious Osso Bucco I have had in years.  Dessert was fun.  I'm not a chocolate addict, and wanted the Tiramisu, but the Mousse pie was tasty. Wine list is average.  If you're not in the far part of the Strip, it may not be worth the taxi fare, but if you have a coupon or special it is worth breaking even.

We stayed in stratosphere and this restaurant is inside the casino.. We went for dinner party of 7.. There wasn't any wait time .. The ambience was really awesome .. The walls were painted with Venice boat tours.. It feels like you were in Venice ... Appetizers were awesome .. Service was really good .. And our food was delivered quickly .. Entrees were perfect the quantity was just perfect for single person.. Not too much and not too less.. We really liked it and we will go again .. Highly recommended for someone who stays here at stratosphere

My husband & I were seated right away & served cold water before we even sat down. Our waiter took our order right away and our food came out so quick! We will definitely come back to this restaurant again when we come back to Las Vegas.

Called to make reservation to use groupon and they refused to accept.  Groupon clearly shows value I paid never expires!  I will never dine at a place that defrauds their customers by selling groupons and refusing to accept them!

With all the great restaurants to choose from here in Vegas, I judge by service.  Everyone can have an off night with the food but it's how they handle it that matters.  I had ravioli and requested a basil cream sauce on it.  The waiter insisted that what came on it was the same as the basil sauce.  It wasn't. They sprinkled basil on it (which he pointed out) but it was not what I wanted.  There was also waaaaay too much sauce - almost like soup.  And it was way too salty. I ate what I could but the waiter was nowhere to be found and we had a show to go to. When he came with the bill, I told him he should tell the chef the sauce was too salty.  His response?  "You should have told me you don't like salt."  That will be the last time we eat there.
My boyfriend enjoyed a amazing meal at fellinis on Saturday night. Our waiter was amazing, the food was out of this world, and the vibe and decor was on point. We definitely will be back
Lasagne, antipasto and the house red wine made for a delicious dinner. A lot of food at a reasonable price. I'm so glad we dined here after watching the sun set at the Stratosphere.
The chicken parmigiana is off the hook! Veal scallopini incredible! Old school Italian at just the right price! My fave!

Not recommended.  We were in town for a convention and stayed at the stratosphere.  That meant that after a long day on our feet, we didn't feel like going out for dinner, so we tried all three of the casino level restaurants.  This was the worst of the bunch.  We started with the portobello mushroom appetizer, my husband thought it was OK but the crab tasted very canned.  Also, they didn't bother to brown the top under the broiler- it really had the feel of something that came out of the freezer.  Don't get me wrong, I know that is the reality of a churn and burn low to mid level strip restaurant, but at least make an effort to try and fool me into thinking it was freshly made.  For dinner I tried to play it safe with chicken marsala, it was passable.  It came with a huge side of potatoes - they were seasoned nicely but overcooked.  I tasted one but didn't eat the rest.  My husband had the braciole,  the meat was tender but the sauce was incredibly salty.  He didn't want to send it back because we just wanted to be done.   If you still choose to go there after reading this, maybe try the pizza.  It's harder to screw that up.

Caesar salad is why the restaurant is getting a 1. It was very good. The rest of the food was awful. Pasta was over cooked even though we had ordered it al dente. The kitchen had also over cooked the seafood and it was very chewy.  The sauce was also completely bland. The steak was very charred. Not what I would expect from an Italian steakhouse. Even the dessert was horrible. The creme brÃ»lÃ©e was way too thick and the top part didn't break right. Was sorry we purchased the travelzoo deal and wouldn't recommend this restaurant. There are way better Italian steakhouses in Vegas

Fellini's could be as good as a 4-star, depending upon your expectations and circumstances.

Atmosphere for dinner was dark and intimate while also casual, which was nice. Things were quiet at this far end of the casino, past the 50s diner and box office, and the restaurant was no exception.

The garlic cheese bread, to me, looked and tasted like those free bread sticks you get with certain brands of frozen pizza. I'm not saying it was bad, just kind of ordinary comfort food with a "I could have made this at home, and made it better, if I weren't so lazy to be buying frozen pizza tonight." (Except we weren't buying frozen pizza, so...)

Diners who arrived after us were all reassured that their complimentary bread baskets were "on the way." Us? We didn't get one. Maybe because we ordered the garlic cheese bread? Still, it would've been good to have had a variety of bread, especially if the basket contains flatbreads, which I love. We didn't say anything because at that point we'd already moved on to the main course, but just know that apparently you're supposed to get a bread basket.

I had the raspberry salad and was charmed for a few bites, just because I don't usually have raspberries in salads, but soon I was disappointed in the one-note flavor of greens drenched in sweet raspberry dressing with a few raspberries about. This dish could use another element - maybe a nut or a bit of cheese.

Mike enjoyed his steak, and I have to admire any place that can cook something well-done without making it into a slab of dry cardboard.

I ordered the angel hair with garlic and olive oil. It was good, but the noodles swimming in a lake of sauce that was so deep they should've been equipped with water wings. Said lake was also so hot that I was on my third bite as my husband finished his steak. 

That was okay - I decided it would be easier to eat the leftovers at home when it was cooler and I could drain the noodles a bit. It's not the most pleasurable dining experience when flecks of hot oil keep flying around and scalding your skin or staining your shirt. But the flavor was nice, I'll give it that. (But when Mike took the to-go box to the car, he did note that bottom of the box was so searing hot that he couldn't touch it for long.)

I'd sum Fellini's up as 4-star selection at 3-star taste (for me) with some minor sub-3 aspects but 4/5-star service. Everyone from chef to waiter was very friendly, and refills on our lemonades were fast. It's a solid option for those staying at the Strat, and I'd look forward to trying something different if it was, say, a friend's fave restaurant and I had a good reason to return.

This Italian restaurant simply surprises me for the quality of the food dispute the old style of their renovation. Their servers are fast and friendly, and the bread with olive oil/vinegar/ butter is also good taste. The price is fair ( I feel like a little too cheap when comparing to the quantity and quality).

The fried Calamari is so fresh and with a large portion ( all of their dishes are really large in quantity). The Linguine Mediterranean pasta has so many seafoods that you cannot even see the pasta itself, but it's not greasy at all!!! We are surprised that it's only $24.95. 

We have another pasta with shrimp, mushroom, and fettuccine ( can't remember the name of the dish). It is also a good combination with lots of shrimps.

I feel a little pity for the restaurant cause they would have more reviews if their location is closer to the strips and would have more customers for sure.

I would definitely recommend this restaurant and would want to come here next time!

Every time I come to this restaurant the food is delicious and the service is great. While you wait for your meal they give you the classic Italian bread with butter in basil olive oil. So yummy. They have a filet mignon gnocci that is to die for. I always make sure to stop here whenever I'm in Vegas.
Best Italian cuisine I've had in a while!! Service is excellent ! Portions are large!

We had our wedding dinner here after doing the ceremony in the Chapel upstairs.

They gave us a private room for our party of 19 and despite being a party of 19, allowed us to order off the menu instead of doing a set menu. They said they would not have been able to accommodate if there was a second wedding party that night so we lucked out.

Like every restaurant, not every dish is a winner but there wasn't anything that stood out as bad and most people enjoyed their food.

Service was fantastic. Our waiter took care of our every need and made sure everyone was having a good time. We were made to feel welcome and appreciated.

The kitchen staff are also to be commended as the food managed to pretty much come out all at the same time. That's excellent kitchen management.

Our wedding cake was also excellent. We got white cake with strawberry filling and chocolate ganache. Even people who don't normally like cake, liked this one.

You should definitely come here.

In my opinion, this is the best restaurant inside stratosphere. Seated immediately, friendly courteous and timely server with a visit from the chef himself, good portions, fair price, cool ambiance and pleasant atmosphere. Was casual but had an option to be romantic and dressy. Tasty. Fulfilling. And authentic. My kind of Italian joint.

Really great service and the food was delicious! I am not a big pasta eater, but my boyfriend and I visited Las Vegas for the first time and stayed at the stratosphere so we had to check it out. I ordered the garlic cheese bread which was divine (a layer of cheese garlic Parmesan on top of crispy soft bread). Then I ordered the cheese ravioli which was also super delicious! My boyfriend too enjoyed the spaghetti carbonara he ordered. The food was overall very flavorful and a good place to take someone who may be picky about Italian food.

Loved this place! Food (chicken parm and the hubby had ravioli w and an AMAZING pink sauce) and service  were superb! Definitely a great find! The bread and dipping sauce amazing. I don't even care for bread and loved it!

Pretty much an average place - decent food, friendly service and Nice scenery. The piazza was especially oily and enough food for two. The salad was also good. Very convenient since it's inside the hotel.

Dinner tonight with my friend Steve to Fellini's at the stratosphere. Such an awesome old school Italian gem. The shrimp Caesar to start was delicious with large and many shrimp with creole flavor and spice. I had the veal vandoastana! A 12 0z veal chop stuffed with prosciutto and fontina cheese, breaded and sautÃ©ed in a sherry wine sauce. Our server said this was his favorite dish and I see why, a 10/10. That sherry wine sauce alone would taste magnificent on regular pasta. Steve had the beef brasiola and that was just as good. I highly recommend this place and will definitely be back to try the gnocchi in Gorgonzola cream sauce with tenderloin. Thank you so much Kevin Calder for the wonderful Christmas present of this coupon and meal. I would have never tried this place. Thank you so much

This place is amazing! We chose Fellini's for our  wedding reception, (9-18-15) without even trying the food. The coordinator, Mimi Lopez, the executive  chef, Joseph Siano, our waitstaff went above and beyond to make it perfect! The food was delicious. The cake was way more beautiful than we expected and the best cake anyone's had. Our guests are still talking about it, saying that it was the best wedding food they've ever had. Thank you for making our special day even more special! 
Corinne & Olga

Just recently went to Vegas and stayed at the Stratosphere where Fellini's is located. Had no plans of going to the restaurant, but I am so glad I did. My group of friends and I all agreed that we received the best service we have ever experienced. Our waiters name was Valon and he was absolutely fantastic. He was very knowledgeable of the menu, attentive, and went the extra mile for us with every detail of our dinner. Not only was Valon great, but the entire wait staff was so kind and helpful. A restaurants food can be great, but if the staff isn't as great it will go no where. Fellini's nailed it in both categories, but the main reason I will be back is because of the excellent staff. Thanks for a wonderful dinner!

I had my destination wedding reception here after my ceremony at the Flamingo Hotel for my 50 wedding guests. Planning my trip from Florida, everything was via email and phone calls, but Joe was amazing. He answered all my questions and fulfilled all my requests very promptly and always did his best to make what I needed happen, even changes we had to make last minute on the day of. The food was amazing and my husband is still talking about the how much he loved the wedding cake, which we ordered from them as well. It was so good! The service we had during the dinner was top notch. Everyone was so professional and accommodating. We had a private room that we were allowed to decorate and I was able to have my reception without having to use a banquet room and go over my budget. I cant say enough wonderful things about Joe and his team! Everything was perfect!

I had the grilled lamb chop and it was wonderful! We also had the stuffed portabello which was a very large stuffed mushroom. Im used to mini stuffed mushrooms, so this was a nice surprise! One of my friends got lasagna and the other had pasta. They enjoyed their meal as well but i believe mine took the cake!

This is a great place. We had a Travelzoo voucher which helped. The shrimp on the caesar was fabulous as was the veal. Hubby had the porterhouse and minestrone both which were gone from plate and bowl by the time he was done. Finished off with the turtle cheesecake - yum. Very quiet place, fabulous service - our waiter was Steve - request him if possible. Oh and I loved the background music playing. We will be back for certain.

Like the Italian restaurants I grew up with in San Francisco, a monument to thoughtful and meticulous choreography and attention to detail. I dined here twice in succession, almost completely different crews on the floor, so the quality was no fluke, it's intentional. The staff is very attentive and highly coordinated. The waiters know the menu in every detail and they also know the details that aren't on the menu; the bussers are in and out before you even realize something needs doing; and the restaurant manager has his eagle-eye everywhere like the conductor of a great symphony, making certain that the diner never sees under the hood and just hears the purr of the engine. The portions are ample and done however you ask for them to be done. The atmosphere is intimate and comforting, the lighting is moderate and soothing; I'd rather hear Sinatra coming over the surround sound but the ambient music is pleasant enough. I've never stayed in the Stratosphere and probably won't again, but I will gladly take the taxi ride to dine here again.

unexpectedly delicious.
even though the loud wallpaper didn't reenact italy for me,, the food and service compensated for..

came here with my non exploratory traditional asian folks and they loved it so hence the extra brownie points

the garlic cheese bread was on point, not too buttery, cheesy and noticably GARLIC-ky. MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM. Ciabatta style, good touch.

Penne with Lobster and Asparagus- mmmmmm. so cheesily good and worked well with the lobster. 

Linguine Mediterranean - yum. too much "rubber band looking' calamari but everything else on the dish......clams, mussels, shrimps, scallops was plentiful. and the linguine wasn't overcooked, YAY!  very delightful. 

wished my folks drank red wine so i could've popped a bottle but then drinking four glasses on your own while your parents stared on...in dreadful silence....is a bit of a foolish move.
so i went with a GLASS of house red merlot which worked, merrily we rolled aong.

great dine at the strato'! woot woot.
Loved the atmosphere,  incredible entrees, delicious wine, and fantastic service.  Will be returning again and again.

OMG is all I can say! Great food and the atmosphere was out of this world. Loved the Italian theme, the art was stellar and I will be going back just to view more of the murals. I had the pizza which was just the right size. My lady had the pasta which she also loved. Very romantic and probably the best you can do for Italian food on this part of the strip.

Judging from the other reviews here, I must have come on an off-day. My wife and I picked this place because of the high reviews for an Italian restaurant in that part of town, and we went in with high expectations. 

The first disconcerting thing is that the perspective on the frescoes on the wall is just subtly off enough to give you vertigo the moment you walk into the dining area. Starting off the meal with a faint sense of ill-ease doesn't help the experience. They have beautiful white cloth tablecloths on the table - they cover that with a big sheet of paper, which totally detracts from the ambiance. 

Then came our waiter. I don't know if he had left his girlfriend in the walk-in freezer mid-stroke and was anxious to get back to her, but he was about halfway through our drink order before he was already running away. I almost had to shout across the dining area to get him to hear that both of us wanted a drink, and not just my wife. He disappeared for a long time, and resurfaced after I'd decided, forgotten, and re-decided what I wanted to eat.  We put in our order, he disappeared. He returned a reasonable amount of time later with our carpaccio.

The carpaccio was, quite simply, delicious. However, at any of the other highly-priced Italian restaurants in this city, for the same price, we'd get about double. I expected better; at this point, I was already regretting not going to Scarpetta or The Grotto. Once we finished that, they brought out the bread. Normally, in other restaurants, that comes before the appetizer, but, hey, however they want to do it. 

I ordered the Tortellini Abbruzzese. It had a nice flavor, but could have benefited from using prosciutto instead of sausage. A stylistic choice of the chef with which I don't agree, I'm sure, but it would have made it more enjoyable to me. That said, I still enjoyed it. 

My wife, however, ordered the Linguine Mediterranean. The seafood in it was probably fresh three days prior to us ordering it; by the time it arrived at our table, however, it had a distinctly Billingsgate odor and taste. It was not pleasant. At $22 for a pasta dish, I expect fresh seafood in it. Fortunately, when we got home and gave the three-fourths of it that we had left over to the dogs, they were ok with it. And, of course, my wife won't be happy until I point out that, unlike other quality Italian restaurants, they gave us that nasty Kraft Parmesan-substitute cheese, instead of some fresh-grated Romano or something else of note. Again, the disconnect between what they pretend to be and how they execute is staggering. It's like they're trying to be Olive Garden at Batali prices. It doesn't make sense. 

Finally, the waiter, whose conspicuous absence the whole evening was keenly felt, came back and tried to get all chummy with us to order desert. If he'd interacted with us in any way, I'd not have felt my skin crawl during the interaction; however, since he had reacted to us as if we had leprosy from the moment we sat, it came across as smarmy and car-salesman-y.  

I hated every second I was in the place, and cannot understand the glowing reviews this place gets. Since I can't imagine that all of the other reviewers are idiots, it really MUST have been just an off night last night. Too bad it was SO far off that they will never get a chance to prove that to me. I wouldn't even accept a free meal from them. 

If you are looking for a good night out of high-quality Italian food, hit up the places where Scott Conant and Mario Batali have restaurants. If you want a smaller name, hit the Grotto at Golden Nugget. If you want cheap and edible, go to Olive Garden or Strings. If you want to drop a ton of cash on stuff that my kids could knock together in our kitchen, go to Fellini's.

So disappointed!  I called and booked a reservation for my wife and I to celebrate our 18th wedding anniversary. George took the reservation and was extremely nice. He told us it would be a memorable night at Fellini's. 
Memorable it was, in the worst way possible!  We arrived about ten minutes before our reservation.  After a few minutes standing and waiting to be acknowledged,  a man walked up and I told him we had reservations for our anniversary.  As I was speaking to him, a party of 6 walked up behind us. He immediately ignored us and took the other party to a table. They heard me mention our anniversary and they all wished us a happy anniversary.  The waiter never returned.
Five more minutes pass and a writer approached and I told him we had reservations.  He simply led us to a table without a word.
A waiter appeared about 3 minutes after we were seated. No how are you? Or, are you celebrating anything? 
Five minutes more pass and we are brought water, no bread. We order and received our food more than half an hour after we ordered.
The restaurant was not busy, but everyone around us seemed to receive quick service.
The food: my wife said her food was OK. I had shrimp Alfredo with six small shrimp grilled and tougher than shoe leather.
The waiter returned and asked if we would like dessert. We declined, had our food boxed up, and another waiter comes over and asks if we were certain we didn't want dessert.
At that point, I wanted to scream. My wife said just let's go.
The bill arrives and we were charged $8 for a salad my wife did not eat, and $8 for bread that came at the time our meal finally arrived. 
I would never recommend this restaurant.  The manager seriously needs to take a hard look at the staff and how the guests are served!

We went there to celebrate my brother's birthday. We were a party of 6. I had purchased a travel zoo deal for 115 for 4 people. The service was impeccable. The server and the bisser were fantastically synchronized.We were all happy with what we ordered and enjoyed it very much. The ambiance was relaxing and quiet which is nice when you are trying to talk to someone next to you or across from you. The dessert was great too,cannolis were fantastic. 
Overall, I would come back again and I would definitely recommend this place!
Awesome food and fabulous service. A must for Vegas. Gonna go home and try to duplicate the fantastic sauce
Very friendly service, nice eating atmosphere.  Good introduction to their manual, treat customer very kindly.  Fresh and high quality seafood and large quantity, I cannot finish my seafood pasta.

This is a hidden gem. When u think of good dining in Vegas the stratosphere usually do not come to mind. The shrimp Caesar salads is die to die for the shrimp are almost the size of a. Prawn is very well seasoned. Calamari is crispy and gal oral.as far as the entrees the penne lobster and asparagus is average would not order again . But the steak and potatoes was surprisingly very delicious seasoned and tender. The service is good for the most part. There are always good deals that you can find I found one on travelzoo once before which allowed for 2 salads and 2 entrees. I almost forgot for kids the pepperoni pizza is delicious as well. All around its a good restaurant to dine at if your looking for some good Italian food but don't want to settle for Olive Garden

We went because we had a Travel Zoo voucher. Not a bad deal but I think we ordered wrong.
The restaurant is very clean and I like the charming decor. Some might say it is kitschy but it is well done and pleasant to look at. The service is equally good. An overall nice experience.
The meal:
Warm bread with butter and oil -very good
Shrimp Caesar salad - tasty and extremely generous portion of grilled shrimp
Lamb chops - average but a very generous portion. The sauce was not necessary. 
Filet Mignon - worst steak ever. I really think it was a sirloin and not a filet. We each took one bite and then just left it. Didn't return it since we were using a coupon. Very low quality of beef. Probably should have ordered something other than steak.
Godiva chocolate mousse cake- above average but a little too sweet for my taste.

This restaurant is excellent! The service is beyond compare. I ordered the carpaccio and the veal osso bucco. Unbelievable. The veal is served with a small fork specifically for getting at that incredible marrow. The sauce for the veal, may be a bit much for some. However, in my opinion it compliments the marrow perfectly. As for the service, impeccable. For dessert we ordered the Tira Missou. My daughter who is 4 wanted a vanilla ice cream. Our waiter explained that they didn't have any, however offered to head to the casino break room to get her a cone. Who else would do that? Best waiter ever! 
I am usually not fond of a tip minimum put on parties, however, they more than earn it at this establishment. 
Highly recommended for food and especially service. I will definitely be back. Often.
Delicious!  Highly recommend the Fellini salad! I've eaten here several times and have always had a great meal and incredible service.

Walked past by this place multiple times and picked up the menu to see what they had. Finally my lady and I decided to eat here, because we were feeling a little exhausted from sight seeing all day and didn't want to go out for food. 

We read previous Yelp reviews about this place and saw a few people mention the serving sizes were huge. When we ordered we got a pasta dish and a salad dish and told him we were sharing the plates because of the serving sizes, he said he would split the dishes into two for us. We are used to having to ask for two plates to split our dish. 

That was a first for us and plus all the small knick knacks made our experience better. 

The best service we've had ever in Vegas! By chance the best Italian food I've had here in Vegas. The service was outstanding! Unforgettable.

Loved our dining experience at Fellinis. They even had a whole gluten free menu! consisting of pastas, sauces, etc... boy have i missed alfredo sauce! my boyfriend and i both shared the smoked salmon appetizer. delish! a piece of chilled smoked salmon dressed with capers, oil vinegar with a side of smokey cream cheese. for my entree i had a shrimp alfredo with gluten free pasta. it was so amazing. Steve our server was phonom too. i will def make my way to the stratosphere just for this restaurant.

The hotel this place is in, the Stratosphere, is a dump.  But Fellini's is excellent, even by Vegas standards.  One note:  the portions are HUGE.  Share!  We got the stuffed portobello mushroom and the Mediterranean linguine.

The house bread is served warm and crispy.  It comes with a little bowl of olive oil/vinaigrette dip which oddly has two scoops of butter in it.  Scoop out the butter and just use the dip.

The portobello mushroom was delicious.  Different layers and lots of melted cheese.  I could definitely taste the crab, the caramelized onions, and the two different types of mushrooms.

My date got the Mediterranean Linguine.  It had a bit too much spiciness to it. Also, the sauce was too thin for my liking.

The bread plus the linguine dish would have been more than enough for two people to share.

The prices are a bit high but keep in mind the portions reflect this.  Two adults that love to eat could go and fill up on just the bread and two appetizers.

The service was excellent.
It was fine food but I want more flavors. My wife and I both liked our food and the service was fine nothing stood out. It wasn't toad nor awesome it was fine and yes I would go back

UN-expectantly the worst Filet Mignon I have ever had. Outside of the steak was burnt, dry and tasteless but inside is medium well. $30 for the black steak cardboard.

AND the server didn't even bother to ask how was our meals, refill drinks or refill bread?! But rest assured they automatically add 18% gratuity even though I think they didn't deserved it. Check totaled $97 for four adults. 

RIDICULOUS! NEVER HERE AGAIN, EVEN IF IT'S FREE.

Absolutely tremendous Ossobuco. Easily some of the best I've ever had. Rissotto was very good and the wait staff was very friendly. The only reason I'm not giving this a 5 star is the wait time was a bit much It took our our table (12+) almost 20 minutes to be served from the first entree to the last which made some of our food to be cool by the time we able to salute each other. Regardless, the food here makes up for almost any wait time!
This place is outstanding. I go about twice a year when I'm in Vegas for work. Everything I've ever had there is good.

After an excellent first course of calamari, we waited a really long time for two of our meals to come out overdone. Pizza crust burnt. Salmon really overdone. They took both off the bill but the experience was subpar. My lamb shank was decent.

Went here with my boyfriend this past Saturday on a Travelzoo voucher.  Having used a voucher once before on another Italian restaurant in Vegas(Capos) and being quite disappointed, I was a little bit anxious about this one.  However, I needn't be.  We were staying at the Cosmopolitan so we took a taxi down to the Stratosphere...it was worth the trip.  
Cute restaurant with various different Italian scenes painted on the walls.  Our server was very friendly and helpful.   
Our voucher was for two salads/soups...two entrees...and one dessert.  
I had been wanting just some good ol' spaghetti and meatballs...and that is what I got.  It was very good.  I'm not sure that i could say the BEST I have ever had...but it was pretty darn good.  The boyfriend had a rib eye and was quite impressed!  The only bad thing was that the portions were large....and by the time we had eaten our salads...one garden salad..one Caesar..and the yummy bread...we didn't have much room left!  Fortunately...our hotel room had a microwave...so we brought home leftovers which the boyfriend had for breakfast the next morning!  
All in all....a very enjoyable experience!
Ok Raviolis were awesome! Incredible tiramisu as well. Wine selection was not that great. Service impeccable!
Took are family here for dinner during our trip to Las Vegas it was amazing can't complain about anything service was great food was amazing. Would definitely  come again while in Vegas.

On its website, it says Fellini's is "two-time Zagat rated and voted "Most Romantic Restaurant" in the 2005 Best of Las Vegas Review-Journal Poll."  I had no idea about that while I was there, but I did enjoy myself.

We were spending one night at Stratosphere, and needed dinner before heading up to sleep before waking up at five am for our flight.  Ugh.  So, this was kind of our goodbye.  We were sat directly by the host stand, so which was at the end of a row of tables made to look like patio dining, except that the whole restaurant is inside.  This happens a lot in Vegas, so I was kind of used to it at this point, but it feels half weird, and half like you really are dining afuera.

Anyway, so we didn't get the whole picture for ambiance, since we technically never saw the inside, but the waiters really did seem Italian, which was kind of a neat touch, and the food was delicious.  We both had fabulous pasta, which was pretty authentically Italian but also had those American fixings we like so much (basically, cheese, and bring it.)  Prices were reasonable for Las Vegas, and the meal was probably the most delicious of our vacation.  Yummy!

Came here for dinner while staying at the Stratosphere. So much fancier than what you see passing by. Very impressed by the service and the quality of the food. I ordered the Fettucine Capriciano and it was so delicious. They were extremely generous with the shrimp and I was very happy. It was so much that I couldn't finish it, I had to take it up to the room with me

Oh man are these people are great! I had my rehearsal dinner for my wedding here in a nice private room in the back. We had a pre-fixed menu for 28 with 4 courses. Antipasti, ravioli, salad or soup and then a choice of 4 entrees. Basic beverages were included. All of the food was great! Fresh, seasoned well and presented lovely. They allowed my guests to start a tab if they wanted alcoholic beverages. The entire staff was VERY accommodating. Stephano our waiter was exceptional (I hope I got his name right)! :) I highly recommend this restaurant!

This review is for the service, not for the food!   My parents was excited to go to Vegas, and wanted to try this restaurant.  When they were there, it did not seem busy inside, and she told the waiter 2 people, and the waiter did not check inside at all, just pointed the small table near the entrance and told my mom that's the only table he had.  He did not even ask if my parents want to wait for better table.  His tone was not friendly with attitude.  My parents were not happy with his attitude, and they left.  It should be a beautiful night at Vegas, but the service was not good enough for Vegas standard!

This place's atmosphere is like an authentic Italian restaurant. Having walked the strip all day, I wanted Italian food. I had the Ravioli and it was soooo goood. The night before we had really bad pizza from a hotel restaurant and were reluctant to trying anything else from a hotel. The staff were really good, never had to ask for a refill for our waters. My BF was so impressed, he personally tipped the table attendant guy (different from the waiter). My BF had some type of pasta dish (I can never remember what he ordered) and he said his was pretty good. 

Based on what we ordered I can say the food and service were really good and would definitely eat there, if I ever go back to Vegas.

This restaurant was terrible! We ordered the swordfish, not good, covered in a red tomato sauce, came with potatoes that looked like parsnips - not appetizing at all. We had the veal and it was hard and dry, but covered in a salty sauce. The caprese salad was great, the minestrone soup was good but no meat or legumes just vegetables. The tiramisu was excellent. Sad, we thought it was going to be our highlight but what a dissappointment!

This place was amazing. Great atmosphere, beautiful Italian decor, amazing food. They brought out warm bread with a garlic oil butter. Caprese salad was yum! Great value too Over all! We all 4 ordered some sort of steak dish. We compared steak houses and considered the dollar sign ratings for cost before going- we were very impressed for the prices, it was so worth it. And only $$! 
Highly recommend this place for great steak, seafood and pasta dishes!

So we are locals, we live, eat, and play here so we are always looking for new places to try. We take advantage of, Travelzoo, Groupon, LivingSocial and the local papers for good deals. We tried Fellini's because I read all the reviews and thought, ok it's a strip restaurant and it's got good reviews. Now the deal was $59.00 for dinner for two, this included a soup or salad, a main entree up to $34.95 and a shared desert. Not a bad deal. It also offered a 25% discount if you chose to add an appetizer. Now the restaurant recommends reservations so I made one. There was really no need as the place was empty when we got the at 6:00 pm on a Friday night on the strip. We though that a little unusual but some people like to eat later. We were greeted by our waiter who introduced himself and asked for our drink order. He was friendly well informed about the menu and made some great suggestions for wines, appetizer, and entree's. we took advantage of the discount and ordered the bruschetta, it took 30 minutes to get to the table. 30 minutes for toasted bread with some chopped tomatoes REALLY ! it was tasty but nothing to write home about. We ordered the Caesar Salad it was really good but a bit over dressed. I ordered the linguine and white clam sauce. It was over loaded with onions which I don't care for in this dish. Overall the rest of it was bland, bland, bland. My husband ordered the spaghetti carbonara. Now this dish is supposed to be in an egg sauce with either pancetta or bacon and parmigiana cheese. It came in an Alfredo sauce. We didn't finish our dinners box them up and took them home to our dogs. We chose the cannoli's for desert. I don't know what was wrong but it had a soapy or perfume after taste. My husband didn't taste it so maybe it was just me. To be fair the shells were crispy and you could tell the cream was freshly made, just what you want in a good cannoli. So that's it. The waiter was GREAT, the kitchen was slow with the appetizers but got better with the rest of the meal. The food was just ok nothing to rave about. At $59.00 for the dinner another $45.00 for the drinks, appetizer and an automatic 18% gratuity added. Which by the way is one of the reasons I think the restaurant isn't as good as it could be. I think everyone I did see had a coupon. The staff know there getting there 18% either way. We eat out often and the real test of a good restaurant is consistently putting out good food. The key word is consistent. So fo a $100.00 meal that was pretty poor we won't be going back. Sorry, we were hopeful that we found a new favorite but not today. I'll take Nora's restaurant on Flamingo any day of the week and twice on Sunday. The best Italian food in town !

Very good Italian food nestled in the back of the casino. Lovely atmosphere, good service, reasonable prices. The chef even came out to make sure things were going well. I had the salmon fettuccine special, which turned out to have a really heavy cream sauce. The salmon was a bit fishy, but I guess I can't expect the freshest fish in Vegas. I'm not really a fan of cream sauces, but it was tasty. My dining partner had linguine carbonara, which was delicious. The garlic bread was oh so yummy! We also had the Fellini salad, which was sooo good. Fresh raspberries and a great vinaigrette. Get the dressing on the side if you are into light dressing as I am. The salad was big enough to split and they split it for you if you ask which was nice. We had a great dining experience there. be aware their other location on Charleston is closed, but it seems like the one in the stratosphere has expanded to compensate.

I GOT FOOD POSIONING!! While eating their food, it tasted alright, nothing special but not disgusting either. It seemed to be a decent meal when a couple of hours later I was vomiting from their food. Not the best of ingredients if I was sick from them, and on top of that, the atmosphere was a little weird too. I'll give them some credit because it wasn't completely terrible but I'm pretty sure getting sick and throwing up from their food warrants a negative review.

Excellent place. Husband's Chicken marsala was fantastic. I had a pasta with steak pieces (can't remember the name) and that was very good too. Next time we will try some desserts because we ordered so much nothing could fit anymore.

Had a lovely dinner the other night.  Thanks to Travelzoo for an amazing bargain.  Ambiance is great and service was top notice. Our mains were 9 ounce lobster tail and a veal chop.  Both cooked perfectly.  We started with lobster bisque and mozerella tomato salad, both very nice.  Enjoyed a carafe of the house chianti.  It was all more food than we could eat!
